reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was traveling with my wife, after spending some time in Yosemite National Park. On our way out from the park, we stayed at the hotel seeing that it was new. The rooms were great, large (we had double queen beds, and the room could easily fit a family of 4), and very clean. This is the first time I have stayed at Hampton Inn (preferring Starwood Hotels, since I am an SPG Platinum guest). Will definitely come back if we plan another Yosemite visit.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel Between Yosemite & SF/ Bay Area

reviews.text: BTW, the full breakfast offering were just about right for a good meal to start your day off. My wife and I appreciate the fresh fruits (banana, melons) and hot waffles. =)
reviews.title: Very nice new Hampton Inn

reviews.text: This is by far the nicest of the new Hampton properties I have stayed at. The rooms are very comfortable. Nice big LCD televisions with plenty of channels. Very comfortable bed and great bedding. The hotel has nice colors and made me feel right at home.
reviews.title: What a wonderful staff and facility!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I didnt find the staff to be really eager to help me, I did not encounter the problems one of the other reviews mentioned. One little side note; I walked by the front counter a few times looking for the ice machine. Its in the entry corridor (odd design). There were 4 people at the front desk. Typically at Hamptons you are greeted multiple times a day when you encounter the staff members. The staff at the desk had their heads down looking at the computer screen and didnt notice there was someone waiting to check in nor did they notice I was lost. Only reason I mention it is one of those people was the hotel GM I found out. Not very service minded at all.
reviews.title: Excellent new Hampton
Nice hotel, but beware of the day front desk staff.
reviews.text: Would definately suggest you visit this place. The rooms are great. Service didnt bother me much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Manteca, CA to visit family. This is a fairly new place so it is well taken care of. My husband and I were very surprised that the bathrooms do not have fans. You have to take a shower with the door open in order to let the steam out of the bathroom. This is a new hotel, how do you not put in fans in the bathroom????? The breakfast options are great. If you go hungry here, its your own fault. Coffee all day and in the afternoon they have cookies with your coffee.Newspapers everyday.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Excellent hotel property. New, clean and well appointed rooms. Friendly desk staff. Located next to Bass Pro, Red Robin, AMC theaters & shopping center.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: We have stayed at alot of Hamptons and this was a great experience. It was easy to find just off 120 between Yosemite and San Francisco. It was fair nice, almost new, and very modern for a Hampton's interior. The rooms were great and we slept well after our day of hiking at Yosemite. The staff was great and they had "to go" bags prepared for breakfast which is the way I prefer so we could get on the road to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Really Great Hampton - Highly Recommended

reviews.text: This is an excellent well managed hotel with friendly staff. The breakfast is excellent and the location , next to restaurants is very convenient. It is just great for travellers on I-5.
reviews.title: A good hotel for travellers in Ca.

reviews.text: good, growing area. You have Bass Pro Shops, JC Penney and other stores in walking distance.
reviews.title: New Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Although I have stayed at a Hampton Inn numerous times, on this occasion I was unable to sleep well. I couldn’t modulate the ambient temperature primarily because this hotel furnishes its beds with only a duvet and sheet. This left me either too warm or too cold.
reviews.title: 100% Satisfaction Guarantee? Beware.

reviews.text: The next morning I told the desk clerk I was dissatisfied with this arrangement. Other than affirming that all Hampton Inn beds are so furnished, he didn’t seem to care.
reviews.title: Beautiful new Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I responded to the perfunctory Hampton survey after my stay, I made it clear I was dissatisfied with my experience. I also asked about the 100% satisfaction guarantee. Gina, the front desk manager, responded with, “If you are not satisfied, we don't expect you to pay. Should you ever stay at a Hampton Inn property and encounter any problems causing you not to be 100% satisfied with your stay, simply visit the front desk at any time before check out and mention you would like the 100% Hampton Guarantee due to the problem you encountered.”
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, I did just that except I didn’t explicitly ask for a refund. Shouldn’t it be obvious to an employee that I had encountered a problem and respond accordingly?
reviews.title: The most A-M-A-Z-I-N-G surprise

reviews.text: I followed up with a letter to Hilton management. Their response was, basically, “We hope you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the near future.”
reviews.title: Everything that matters... What a surprise!

reviews.text: I have been meaning to write a review of this great Hampton Inn in Manteca California for awhile now. Our family rented two Jacuzzi suites here for two nights in August 2011. The hotel is new, clean, comfortable, quiet, safe and attractive. The rooms are spacious with a separate large Jacuzzi area, comfortable bedding and a small kitchenette area with frig. Breakfast is included and is wonderful, especially the delicious waffles and sausages! WIFI is free and our rooms had two flat screens TV’s with a full menu of movies and channels. The hotel grounds are attractive with extensive water features and a nice pool and Jacuzzi area. Staff is professional, helpful and courteous. The hotel rates are a real bargain to boot! The hotel is centrally located within easy access to everything in Manteca. I highly recommend this hotel as the best available in both Manteca and Stockton. It is a much safer option than staying in Stockton and is an easy twenty-minute commute to downtown Stockton. I highly recommend this new and upscale Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Wonderful Option for Manteca or Stockton!

reviews.text: This is a nearly new facility with comfortable quiet rooms and very good service. A good place to stop over on the way to or from Yosemite etc. We particularly liked waking up and seeing open fields out the window. true, were it not for the housing crisis, those fields would already be subdivisions. But they are not yet. For the outdoors set, Bass Pro next door is a destination in itself.
reviews.title: Comfortable and restful

reviews.text: We had a nice surprise - we weren't expecting much, but the hotel is quite new (I think) and although it's not walking distance from the downtown strip of shops and restaurants, there is a new shopping development behind the hotel, which at the moment has a cinema and a few eateries, as well as a department store. We booked a king room, which was a great size, including a sitting area. Beds were comfy, and the bathroom was a very good size. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and the whole hotel felt clean and safe.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all, it's great for a stopover, which was our reason for choosing the hotel and town.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here one night on our way to Yosemite National Park after flying in to Sacramento, CA. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We carry a Hilton Honors Card and were able to check in upon early arrival. The room was very nice and clean. We liked the convience and the size of the town. Bass Pro was next door and a nice place to eat was just a short walk around the corner. After a nice breakfast at the Hampton and shopping at the local Wal Mart for food supplies we left for the rest of our journey.
reviews.title: Hampton is good,
